image.altText: Police and officials in front of a barricade holding back protesters.

items.synopsis: Donald Trump has arrived in Washington after being indicted on charges related to his conduct in the 2020 presidential election. Follow our live updates.

title.children: Trump faces 2020 election interference charges in Washington DC

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The ABC's North America correspondent Barbara Miller is on the ground as things prepare to get underway. She says today's hearing is expected to be reasonably short. Barbara: Possibly only around half an hour in total and we expect him to be asked to enter a plea to the four charges he's facing. On the way here Donald Trump's been on his social media quite a lot as he travelled form his New Jersey golf club here to DC.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: What to expect from Trump's court appearance in DC

children.content: is on the ground as things prepare to get underway.
She says today's hearing is expected to be reasonably short.

mediaThumbnail.caption: ABC reporter Barbara Miller explains the charges Trump is facing and describes the scenes outside the DC courthouse where his arraignment will take place.

children.content: Possibly only around half an hour in total and we expect him to be asked to enter a plea to the four charges he's facing.
On the way here Donald Trump's been on his social media quite a lot as he travelled form his New Jersey golf club here to DC.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Our reporter Jade Macmillan says the former president has a pile of papers in front of him, and appears to be sitting in between two of his lawyers. Donald Trump is sitting at a wooden table, whispering to one of his lawyers and appearing to glance around the room. Mr Trump is mostly sitting with his hands clasped together. Reporters in the media room cannot currently hear any sounds from the live TV feed.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Donald Trump has entered court

children.content: Our reporter Jade Macmillan says the former president has a pile of papers in front of him, and appears to be sitting in between two of his lawyers.
Donald Trump is sitting at a wooden table, whispering to one of his lawyers and appearing to glance around the room.
Mr Trump is mostly sitting with his hands clasped together.
Reporters in the media room cannot currently hear any sounds from the live TV feed.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Our reporter Jade Macmillan says US Special Counsel Jack Smith has just been seen entering the courtroom.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: US Special Counsel Jack Smith enters court

children.content: Our reporter Jade Macmillan says US Special Counsel Jack Smith has just been seen entering the courtroom.
US Special Counsel Jack Smith arrives at court.

items.synopsis: A senator challenges why AFP Commissioner Reece Kershaw did not disclose his friendship with a senior PwC partner while designing a contractwith the firm, as SMS exchanges show plans to catch up over a beer, jokes and references to leaks.

title.children: SMS exchanges between AFP commissioner and PwC 'mate' revealed, as top cop faces questions over conflict of interest

image.altText: Three Chinese police officers outside a court building.
